articles.author: Julián F.L.
articles.description:
A recently released art book for The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom has revealed that it was planned to have a different title. And that original title might have spoiled one of the game's biggest twists.


Obviously, know that major spoilers for The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom will follow. If you haven't finished the game yet, read at your own peril.


Nintendo released the Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom "Master Works" art book in Japan on August 30, 2024. Thanks to this, Legend of Zelda fans got a fascinating first look at a great amount of concept art for what was one of 2023's biggest and most critically acclaimed games. However, a very interesting piece of new information didn't come from the art itself, but from something the producer of the game, Eiji Aonuma, revealed …
articles.title: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom almost had a title that gave away a big twist

articles.author: Franklin Bellone Borges
articles.description:
One of the most divisive mechanics since its addition to the franchise, the ability to flop is seen by many NBA 2K25 players as a good tool when facing even matchups, as well as a sure way to lighten the mood when playing with friends.  


But how can you perform the move in the game? Here's how to perform flops in NBA 2K25. 


How to flop in NBA 2K25


A MyCarrer exclusive feature, you can flop in NBA 2K25 by simply pressing the down-direction button on your controller. But you won't be able to do so from the get-go. Instead, you will need to first purchase and equip the emote to your MyPlayer. You can check out how to purchase and equip the flop animation below: 



While in MyCarrer, head to Animations before going to the Animations Store.


Head to In-Game Celebrations and then to either NBA Pro-AM Standing or Park Standard.


Select the flop animation on either section and then head to Cart to purchase it. The animation will cost 100 VC.


Head to the Gameplay Animations tab and equip Flop to both NBA Pro-AM Standing and Park Standard to get access to it.



Image by Destructoid


Should you flop in NBA 2K25?


I don't recommend performing or having the flop emote equipped in NBA 2K25, no matter if you plan on using it while building your legacy or while letting off steam in The City. The reason for that is quite simple, even if we consider the small chance a foul will be called after performing it, you will 100% of the time open a path for the attacker. When playing any non-5v5 mode, that will then lead to guaranteed points. Performing it by mistake when playing on defense can also give a feeling that you are throwing the game. 


Now that you know how to perform flops, don't forget to also check out the best jump shots for all builds, as well as all badge requirements in NBA 2K25.

The post How to flop in NBA 2K25 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to flop in NBA 2K25

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Analogue has announced the next special edition color lineup for their Analogue Pocket consoles. These ones are based on the colors of Nintendo’s Game Boy Color handhelds.


The GBC Colors Edition (I know, Game Boy Color Colors, but it’s an understandable distinction) brings 6 new special edition, er, colors. There’s Dandelion, Kiwi, Grape, Teal, Berry, and Gold. Now, if you’re really astute, you might be thinking, “Why Gold and not Atomic Purple,” since that was the actual six colors available at release. I can’t tell you for certain, but it’s probably because they already had a translucent purple as part of their transparent series. Correct me if I’m wrong, but I believe the Pokemon Gold/Silver special edition GBC was gold? I researched this, but couldn’t find one in good lighting.


Anyway, the GBC Colors Editions are functionally the same as previous models. They’re FPGA-powered handhelds that can run  Game Boy, Game Boy Color, and Game Boy Advance games using hardware emulation, which is significantly more accurate than the usual software emulation that cheaper clones use. People like them. I like their Analogue Duo. More colors are neat.


I got the Kiwi Green shade of GBC when I was younger. I also got a matching green carrying case with a Pikachu on it. It had a thin shoulder strap and my sister and cousins teased me, calling it the Poképurse. In retrospect, that’s not very insulting, but they called it that in a really mean way, so I kind of felt ashamed. This is why I have shame and guilt issues as an adult. A contributing factor, at least.


The GBC Colors editions of the Analogue Pocket will go up for sale on September 12th at 8am PDT and ship within 24 to 48 hours. A restock of the original black/white versions are also coming at that time. The special Editions run for $249.99 USD, which is $30 more expensive than the normal, non-limited colors.

The post Analogue’s new line of GBC shaded Pockets really speaks to me appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Analogue’s new line of GBC shaded Pockets really speaks to me

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
After a series of terrible games, Mega Man X8 restored the series to “tolerable” status. It wasn’t great. It wasn’t even good. But it did shine a lot brighter next to X5, X6, and X7. Maybe the 3D brought it down. The series was really at its best on the SNES. If that’s how your brain works, then have I got a fan demake for you.


I nearly missed this. The friend who gave me the news had missed it. But at the Sonic Amateur Game Expo (SAGE) 2024, Alysson da Paz released their work on a 16-bit-ified version of the Mega Man X series’ most recent game. Everything from that 3D sidescroller has been compressed down, pixelized, and pressed into a new version of itself.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Okay, not everything. Axyl and Zero weren’t implemented and were never planned to be. Alysson states…
articles.title: You can now play the Mega Man X8 fan demake

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
The spine-chilling Haunting event will once again strike fear into the hearts of Call of Duty players, starting the Halloween season early with its Season 6 launch. You'll experience the terror of many horror icons on Sept. 18 for Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone.


If you're a scary movie nut, you'll undoubtedly recognize a bunch of familiar faces from The Haunting event sneak peek. We see the man who has brought on many nightmares for me: Halloween's Michael Myers. In true horror fashion, you'll need to escape from his clutches, amongst many others, while you try to save helpless victims.




You may notice other scary movie nods throughout the trailer, including Sam from Trick 'r Treat, a frightening reference to Smile, and Terrifier's Art the Clown. There are undoubtedly more characters mi…
articles.title: The spooktacular Haunting event will return for Call of Duty: Season 6, bringing iconic horror film characters

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
During Fortnite's Chapter 5, Season 4 story questline, you'll use various War Machine weapons to eliminate opponents before returning to Captain Jones and discussing the next action plan. However, even if you have the mission active, you won't find a map marker for this particular character.


Captain Jones location in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4


Captain Jones is an NPC that spawns in two separate locations. The first spot is a building between the Nitrodrome and The Raft. Nestled between these two POIs is an unnamed location where Captain Jones will roam around, waiting for you to report back to him during this season's storyline.


Screenshot by Destructoid


More specifically, this spot is next to a railroad track directly east of The Raft, southwest of Restored Reels, and northwest of the Nitrodome. It can be hard to find initially, so keep your eyes peeled for a large building near this section of the tracks.


Screenshot by Destructoid


His more common spawn spot is at an unnamed location between Restored Reels and Nitrodome. This time, rather than heading slightly west past the railroad track, you'll move toward a small building between these two spots, east of the road.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Since these aren't popular landing spots, you'll likely only find a few other players in these areas. However, if someone arrives at The Raft to eliminate Emma Frost or the Nitrodome, they might pass through these locations and catch you. Watch your surroundings, and don't be afraid to search around for weapons beforehand.


Captain Jones has multiple uses in Fortnite outside of story quests. You can talk to him to restore your health or buy weapons like the Captain America Shield and Monarch Pistols. There's also extra dialogue about other characters you'll find in the event if you're interested in some Fortnite and Marvel lore.

The post How to talk to Captain Jones about next steps in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to talk to Captain Jones about next steps in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
A new title update is available for Madden 25, and it brings some much-requested changes on all available platforms.


Despite a smooth launch, certain fundamental issues have irritated the players, especially on the defensive side. I have found problems with the defensive coverages outside the deep third, and it now appears that they were working in an unintended fashion. While the total number of fixes in this patch is few, they do take care of some core gameplay concerns.


Madden 25 Title Update patch notes


EA Sports has released the patch notes on Madden 25's community forum, and the official blog post is also available on X. Let's examine all the changes.



Addressed the issue with Smart Routed Custom Stems, resulting in a Speed Boost off the line at the snap


Tuning to decrease the effectiveness of a specific QB-rollout speed boost exploit


Addressed an issue preventing the Curl Flat zone depth coach adjustment from working properly when set at less than 15 yards


Addressed an issue causing Curl Flat defenders to continue to drift away from an eligible receiving threat in close proximity


Addressed an issue causing outside Deep Third defenders to get out of position when covering corner routes, or giving up too much cushion vs. corner routes.


Addressed an issue in Squads causing the QB control to switch to a teammate at the snap



Aside from improper zone coverages, using Smart Routed Custom Stems would sometimes result in an unfair boost at the snap. That problem will likely cease to exist, thanks to the latest update. Similarly, the effectiveness of QB-rollout speed boost has also been nerfed.


Fans will certainly hope that the changes made by the September 10 title update will resolve some of the concerns they have had with the gameplay so far.

The post Madden 25 Title Update patch notes (September 10): Zone coverage fixes and more appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Madden 25 Title Update patch notes (September 10): Zone coverage fixes and more

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Developer Mojang Studios has outlined how work on future updates and features for Minecraft will change. These changes will result in more regular updates of varying sizes and a renewed focus on keeping in touch with the community through Minecraft Live. 


In the past, Mojang has held one Minecraft Live per year and released a big update for Minecraft each summer. Each one is usually sizeable and brings with it dozens of new interactions and possibilities for every player's world. That's now changing so players get more updates each year and two Minecraft Lives so they can keep up to date with what the development team is working on and see more of the behind-the-scenes work. 


More Minecraft


Image via Mojang


As stated by Mojang in its recent blog post, the biggest change to how Mine…
articles.title: Minecraft’s update & new feature schedule is changing

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Sony kicked off the PS5 Technical Presentation with Mark Cerny by jumping right into the announcement of the PS5 Pro. Cerny then took some time to talk about how cool the PS5 is.


He then talks about how developers want higher framerates than 60fps. Or especially higher than 30fps. Apparently, players choose Performance over Fidelity three-quarters of the time. I tend to swap between the two, depending on the game. The framerate thing seems to be the focus of the presentation.




When going over the hardware, Cerny says that it will have a 67% "larger" GPU with 28% faster RAM that apparently renders at 45% faster. It improves Ray Tracing speeds. It is also implementing AI Upscaling (PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution, as they call it). They showed a few games running on both systems and how it improves the framerate without cutting down on the appearance of the game.


Color me unimpressed. I can see the difference, sure, but it doesn’t seem all that dramatic. The presentation really pushed the framerate thing. I like higher framerates, but this feels like worse value than I’d get by upgrading my GPU, which, to be fair, could cost about as much as the PS5 Pro. The upgraded visuals seem pretty miniscule for the price they’re asking. There's also no disc drive, so you'd be paying extra for that. For the deep-pocketed enthusiast, I suppose.


If you’re into it, it’s going to set you back $699. For me, I could barely afford the base model. I'll probably skip on the upgrade. Unless you want to gift it to me.

The post The PS5 Pro is finally announced for a dizzying $700 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The PS5 Pro is finally announced for a dizzying $700

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
The final two parts of Fortnite's Part Four: The Illusionist questline have you spreading graffiti around Doomstadt and ruining its central statue with spray paint. Whether this is a good thing is certainly debatable, but at least the EXP rewards are nice. 


How to graffiti Doomstadt in Fortnite 


Graffitiing Doomstadt requires using sprays to paint icons around the landmark. You can find your sprays by opening your emote menu and hovering over any you currently have equipped. For this particular quest, you'll have to do this four times, alongside one final time on Doomstadt's central statue.


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you didn't have any icons active before, you'll receive the Hopeful Llama spray in your emote wheel, allowing you to finish this quest even as a new player. It also doesn't matter where you use your sprays as long as you stay within Doomstadt. 


With any Fortnite quest comes the risk of encountering enemies, including Mysterio, his henchmen, and other players. Watch for any incoming threats, and be prepared to hide, run away, 


How to graffiti Doomstadt's Central Statue in Fortnite


Graffitiing Doomstadt's central statue is the last task of The Illusionist questline, and it's pretty simple now that you know how to use sprays. You'll find the central statue in Doomstadt's center plaza, where Mysterio spawns.


Screenshot by Destructoid


However, since Mysterio patrols this area, there's a high risk of him or other enemies aggroing on you once you enter the plaza. Make sure to run in here quickly, hop up to the statue, and use your spray before leaving to lower the risk of this happening. As soon as you graffiti the statue, you'll unlock the Hopeful Llama spray and finish part four of the Fortnite x Marvel story.

The post How to graffiti Doomstadt in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to graffiti Doomstadt in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
The word “Shadowrun” is like a magnet for me. It’s like the smell of weird lab bread at Subway; it just hits me in an irresistible way. Apparently, Jordan Weisman, one of Shadowrun’s creators, is teaming up with some other veteran developers to bring us Sea of Legends. It will start its journey on Kickstarter on October 1.


There’s a lot to unpack here, so let’s start with the game. Sea of Legends is described as “a deck-building, open-world, computer role-playing game.” The press release also says to “Imagine a new Sid Meiers’ Pirates game with the tactics and narrative of Shadowrun and Slay the Spire’s deck-building mechanics.”


Image via Endless Adventures


It also sums up the team behind it as including, “Andrew McIntosh, Lead Writer of Battletech, Shadowrun: Dragonfall, and Shadowrun: Hong Kong, Jeffery Campbell, Narrative Designer on Darkest Dungeon, Dead Rising 4, and Deus Ex: Mankind Divided, Kate Cruz, Senior Concept artist on Ubisoft’s Skull & Bones, and Jordan Weisman himself.” There are some things in that list that should maybe have caveats, but, regardless, it’s a good team. It’s based on the tabletop game by Zach Weisman and Ryan Schapals.


It’s also being made in the Adventure Forge platform. I spoke to Jordan Weisman about it some yonks back. It’s a no-code engine that incorporates generative AI for art assets if the creator wants it (it doesn’t say if Sea of Legends will use it). It will, at the very least, be a demonstration of what the tool can do.


I’m interested to see how naval combat is handled. I’m also interested in the feature “lovers to woo.” So, basically, I’m into sailing and smooching. The mock-up included shows the ability to fight, negotiate, or romance to get some treasure. Not sure how that last one works. "We should spend all this gold on a dog that we can spoil together."


The Sea of Legends Kickstarter campaign will kick off on October 1, 2024.

The post Sea of Legends is an open-world pirate RPG from Shadowrun’s creator appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sea of Legends is an open-world pirate RPG from Shadowrun’s creator

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
MIGHTREYA is a 3D hero action game that comes from Japanese indie developer Wazen, and now it has a publisher in 505 Games. The anime-style outing is currently lined up for a 2025 launch on Steam. 


Previously revealed for Steam but without the publishing assistance of 505, MIGHTREYA looks like a fast-paced, fluid actioner with a lot of style. You'll see plenty of notable inspirations in the trailer, which gives off Gravity Rush vibes in the way protagonist Reya puts a topsy-turvy beatdown on her enemies. 




Wazen K has clearly been working on this one for a while. Their X (formerly Twitter) account has been full of prototype videos showing everything from environments to actions for the past few years. Prior to this, Wazen K worked on the Devil May Cry series and released a similarly s…
articles.title: Gravity Rush-style action game MIGHTREYA looks slick, comes out in 2025

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Developer Strange Scaffold has released the post-launch content roadmap for its latest title, I Am Your Beast. Many interesting new features are on the way, including more levels, modes, and angry scope-ripping.


The roadmap for I Am Your Beast was posted on Steam to celebrate the game's launch. It shows that there's a lot still on the way and that the game is worth hopping into early if you like the look of the gameplay. Alongside the new modes and levels promised are controller support and the ability to rip scopes off of sniper rifles to give the game more "Doom (2016) vibes, basically."


More features for more fans


Screenshot by Destructoid


Strange Scaffold explained in its roadmap post that the passion for I Am Your Beast has been noticed, which is why it's pushing to get these …
articles.title: I Am Your Beast to get more levels and Doom vibes in post-launch updates

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Part of your quest to defeat Marvel villains in Fortnite is targeting specific landmarks and weakening their forces before sending your team into a final battle. During Part Four: The Illusionist, you'll target Mysterio by messing around with Doomstadt, including destroying various surveillance cameras monitoring the area.


Where to find surveillance cameras in Fortnite


You'll find surveillance cameras scattered around Doomstadt, particularly along the outer walls of buildings, looking down at various pathways. Below are some specific locations for them:



Along the walls and building foundations surrounding the central statue


On building pillars, including ones on Doomstadt's outer edges


Scattered around the city, pointing toward alleyways and sidewalks




Screenshot by Destructoid


Screenshot by Destructoid


Screenshot by Destructoid


Screenshot by Destructoid



They'll appear as small green and white cameras throughout the landmark, each with around 80 health. You likely won't break them instantly with one pickaxe swing or gunshot, but at least they're weaker than slurp barrels and players.


Although you need to break five surveillance cameras to finish this quest, there are far more than five in Doomstadt to target. They'll always be along solid surfaces like walls, building foundations, and pillars, so focus on checking these areas first for the best odds of finding all five quickly. They're also all outside, so don't worry about going inside buildings for these.


You'll also have to watch for other players, henchmen, and Mysterio, as usual. Entering the center square puts you at risk of entering Mysterio's line of sight, while outer areas might have a player that can catch you off guard with attacks and eliminate you. Make sure to have extra weapons handy and a few hiding spots in mind just in case.

The post How to destroy surveillance cameras in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to destroy surveillance cameras in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Although Fortnite's quests usually have you eliminating enemies, looking for items, and visiting specific locations, the Marvel storyline is a little different. During Part Four: The Illusionist, your first objective is to drop low-quality weapons in Doomstadt. Fortunately, this is quick and easy if you know a few tricks.


How to toss common items at Doomstadt in Fortnite


Tossing common items at Doomstadt is another way of saying you need to throw away your weapons. Doing this requires getting at least one common-tier or grey item, traveling to Doomstadt, and throwing it on the ground. You can do this with the same weapon multiple times, so don't worry about looking for five items throughout your match.


The easiest way to do this is to head directly to Doomstadt at the beginning of the match, look around for grey ground loot, and pick it up. Ground items are usually grey or green-quality anyway, so this shouldn't be too difficult.


Screenshot by Destructoid


From here, open your inventory, hover over your common item, and press the drop button to toss the weapon onto the ground. Now, you can pick it up and repeat the process five times to quickly knock out this quest without much issue.


The only obstacle you might encounter is enemy players finding you and defeating you before you finish dropping your items. Mysterio can also come out of nowhere and attack you if you run within his area of detection. Watch out and listen for anyone nearby, and pick an obscure location, like inside a building or near a hiding spot, to keep yourself away from others. In dire situations, you can sit beside a car and drive away briefly if your character is close to death before returning and finishing the objective.

The post How to toss common items at Doomstadt in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to toss common items at Doomstadt in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Following the game's closure, Sony has now either systematically locked or deleted digital copies of Concord from PS5 consoles. This means that you can't even launch the game to get a server error. Your console simply can't access the game. 


Concord's servers were closed just 14 days after its launch due to a poor reception from players and feedback that Sony and developer Firewalk Studios received from fans during the game's incredibly short lifespan. As of September 10, 2024, I've now found that my digital copy of the game is completely locked so that my PS5 can't even attempt to launch it, and I've seen reviewers say their copies have been removed from their PlayStation Network libraries. 


Ruthless removal


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you aren't aware of this, you will be as soo…
articles.title: Sony locks digital copies of Concord so your PS5 won’t even try to launch them

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Fortnite's Marvel storyline involves defeating Doctor Doom and his allies while working with characters like Captain Jones, Hope, and Shuri. However, there's one problem: several of our friends got brainwashed, and it's up to us to help them. Here's how to wake up brainwashed characters in Fortnite.


How to wake up Brainwashed Characters in Fortnite


Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 has three characters you'll have to visit and wake up for this quest:



Rust


Brite Raider


Peabody



You'll find all three characters in the southern half of the map, with Rust residing near Sandy Steppes, Brite Raider near Brutal Beachhead, and Peabody south of the Nitrodome. You can find their exact locations by tracking the objective in your quest list.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Once you approach a character, speak to them to initiate brainwash-reversing dialogue. After they talk about Doom taking over the world, they'll snap out of it and reveal what caused it, bringing you one step closer to solving this problem. You'll even get small rewards like shield potions and medkits out of it, so it's worth visiting these characters regardless of what you're doing.


While eliminating hired followers is another way to complete this objective, visiting these three locations is much easier, especially since you can do this during one match.


Watch out as you're doing this, though. Other players can easily storm the area and eliminate you or the character you're talking to, preventing you from finishing the quest during that match. If someone approaches the area, talk them out quickly before continuing.

The post How to wake up Brainwashed Characters in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to wake up Brainwashed Characters in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 4

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
The latter parts of the year are no doubt an exciting time if you're hugely into the Call of Duty franchise. Or even if you just take a passing interest in it. Black Ops 6 is just weeks away from release, but there is a little bit of bad news for those who were hoping for some early access fun.


According to a statement sent to CharlieINTEL on X – an account that tracks all things related to CoD – Activision has decided to forgo early access for the campaign for this installment. The full statement reads thus:



The team is fully focused on October 25th. We are excited about all the game has to offer across Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies. This year, we made the decision to ensure the community gets to dig in to any and all modes that they want at the same time, so we are back to one massive global launch moment October 25th. As such, there is no Early Access beat this year for Black Ops 6, just the countdown to launch.




Black Nope 6


As you can imagine, this isn't going down too well with the Call of Duty fan base. A quick look at some of the responses to CharlieINTEL's posts shows more than a few are not happy with the decision Activision has gone ahead with, just weeks before the game launches.


Black Ops 6 will represent the first in the franchise under the Microsoft umbrella. The tech giant bought Activision Blizzard – and therefore the CoD brand – back in 2022 for an eye-watering $69 billion, despite backlash from some regulatory bodies.


Many were initially concerned the acquisition would make the Call of Duty games Xbox exclusives, but Microsoft assured worried gamers this would not be the case. However, Black Ops 6 not having campaign early access is going to leave a sour taste in a lot of people's collective mouths.

The post Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 won’t have early access for the campaign appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 won’t have early access for the campaign

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
If you play a lot of anime-styled Roblox experiences, you're probably familiar with checking out a Trello for weapon rarities before hopping into a Discord server and asking questions. Anime Vanguards is no exception with its growing community, but there is some unfortunate news about its Trello.


Is there a Anime Vanguards Trello link?


Currently, there are no official Anime Vanguards Trello links. While some fan-made ones may exist, there's no word on an official version's release date at the moment. For now, you won't be able to access any information you'd normally find on a Trello page unless you join the Anime Vanguards Roblox group or Discord server.


However, Anime Vanguards is fairly new as of writing this, so there's a chance one will launch in the future. This is especially i…
articles.title: Anime Vanguards Trello and Discord links to connect with the community

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
It was suggested from the very start that Destiny 2's Episodes - the content format for 2024 - would only be a temporary solution. Now, Bungie has doubled down on that notion with a comprehensive explanation of Codename: Frontiers, the next big chapter in Destiny 2's rich and storied history.


Following Bungie's recent integration with Sony, there was a big question mark above Destiny 2's proverbial head. Notably, The Final Shape was an amazing expansion pack, but it also served as an even better off-ramp for veteran players. With no information on what the heck Destiny 2: Frontiers may or may not be, and with the new Episodes just delivering more of the same, it was easy to lose personal investment in the game. Thankfully, Bungie's newly revealed plans for Frontiers sound genuinely inter…
articles.title: Destiny 2 explains 2025’s new content structure, and it sounds… good?

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
LeBron James is arguably one of the most complex builds to make in NBA 2K25 MyCareer mode.


In reality, LeBron is possibly one of those rare superstars who excels in both offense and defense. If you try to make a similar build with MyPlayer, the balancing act becomes very difficult. That said, I did manage to find a build from content creator Joe Knows, which has become my go-to choice. Having played with it for a few days, I can certainly vouch for its potential even as you slowly level up your build with VC.


NBA 2K25 LeBron James build potential overall


Before I get started with the build, do note that if you put 6'6 as your MyPlayer height, you'll get better returns from this build. But we are creating LeBron, and he is 6'8 (so we go with his height). Here are the other key metrics…
articles.title: Best NBA 2K25 LeBron James build in MyCareer mode

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
There are several classes for you to play as and master in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2's PvE Operations mode and PvP Eternal War mode. However, some are definitely better than others, and it varies based on which game mode you play. 


Based on my experience, there are quite a few variables that will change which class is best for you in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2. For example, in the campaign, you have no choice but to stick with Titus and whatever equipment he is given. In Operations mode, the PvE game mode, you can use pretty much any class and feel safe as long as you have the skill to back up the difficulty. When it comes to PvP mode, though, you need to use the right class, or you'll end up getting repeatedly killed because they work very differently in Eternal War. 


Warhammer…
articles.title: Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 class tier list for PvE and PvP

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
Valorant 9.05 patch is here and the new update has buffed a couple of Agents and weapons. It also includes some map updates for consoles and here's a complete rundown of the patch notes.


Update 9.05 has buffed Astra after a long time and Chamber has his Rendezvous radius increased. Ares has also been buffed where it performs better while crouched. Omen has some new voice lines for Viper, Clove, Iso, and Vyse.


What’s new in Valorant patch 9.05?


Astra's Star count increases from 4 to 5, giving her the power back to maneuver between Smokes, Gravity Well, and Nova Pulse just the way it was before patch 7.04.


Chamber's Rendezvous gets a buff too where the teleport radius has been increased from 13 to 18 meters. This will give the Sentinel more freedom when it comes to escaping gunfights…
articles.title: Valorant 9.05 patch notes: Astra & Chamber buff, Ares buff, map updates, more

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
While El Paso, Elsewhere was among my favorite games released last year, this year’s offering from Strange Scaffold has left me somewhat cold. That’s okay. Clickolding and Life Eater were pretty experimental and they just didn’t gel with me.


I was going to overlook I Am Your Beast. Something about its trailers didn’t gel with me, either. At this point, I can’t even remember what it was that made me stick my nose up at it. That’s because when I actually sat down to play it, it didn’t take long to gel with me at all.


Screenshot by Destructoid


I Am Your Beast (PC [Reviewed])
Developer: Strange Scaffold
Publisher: Strange Scaffold, Frosty Pop
Released: September 10, 2024
MSRP: $19.99


You play as Alphonse Harding, who is very violently opposed to doing one last job for his employer, the…
articles.title: Review: I Am Your Beast

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Things are happening in Destinyland, folks. Bungie recently published a huge new blog discussing the future of Destiny 2 from 2025 onwards, and it's nothing if not promising. 2025's first paid DLC, Codename: Apollo, is particularly interesting as it's supposed to be a "nonlinear" experience, of all things.


Historically, Destiny 2's paid annual DLCs have always followed the same format. You get an extremely impressive first mission followed up with a series of bespoke one-off content interspersed with Patrol activities, Strikes, and other repeatable stuff. Then, after loading up your power level and/or grinding an appropriately high level of gear, you jump into the final mission that's sometimes equally as impressive as the intro. Cue the outro cutscene, and you're done. According to Bung…
articles.title: Destiny 2’s next big thing, Codename: Apollo, is ‘nonlinear’ and it has no timegates

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
If you're wondering what the Spotlight Hour schedule for September 2024 looks like in Pokémon Go, we have got you covered.


In Pokémon Go, Spotlight Hours are weekly events during which the spawn rate of certain Pokémon increases. Along with that, you also get more Candy, Stardust, and XP bonuses. Its regular schedule is every Tuesday, starting at 6 pm and ending at 7 pm in your local time.


Image by Destructoid


Next Pokémon Go Spotlight Hour date and time


The next Pokémon Go Spotlight Hour is on September 10, 2024, between 6 to 7 pm. During this time next week, you'd find Dewpider spawning more than usual.


Pokémon Go Spotlight Hour schedule for September 2024


Here's the full Spotlight Hour schedule for September 2024.


Spotlight Hour Date
Time
Spotlight Pokemon
All Bonus
Can you get Shiny Pokemon?




September 3
6 - 7 pm local time
Wooloo
Double Evolving XP
Yes


September 10
6 - 7 pm local time
Dewpider
Double Catch Stardust
Yes


September 17
6 - 7 pm local time
Wobbuffet
Double Catch XP
Yes


September 20
6 - 7 pm local time
Machop
Double Catch Candy
Yes






While the spawn rate of the selected creatures increases during Spotlight Hour, the bonus earned will apply to all.


Can you increase your chances of getting Shiny Pokémon during Spotlight Hour?


Although you can get a Shiny Pokémon during Spotlight Hour, unfortunately, you can't increase your chances. The spawn rates are already boosted during this time of the day, but you can increase your chances of catching one using Incense and Lures.


Now that you know about the Spotlight Hour schedule for the month, be sure to check the game's Raid schedule and Community Day schedule.

The post Pokémon Go Spotlight Hour Schedule (September 2024) appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Pokémon Go Spotlight Hour Schedule (September 2024)

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
It's finally happening, folks: the Director interface that's served as the basic staging ground for all of Destiny 2's core activities is going away. We've already seen some official mockups for the Portal UI, and it both looks and sounds pretty darn solid so far, though I do have concerns.


Destiny 2's new Portal UI is going to be "an easier, modernized way to browse and launch Core Game activities," Bungie promises. "It will offer a varied selection of new and updated activities across a wide range of activity types." Broadly speaking, the goal for the Portal is to give all players a universal jump-off point for activities both new and old. Functionally, that's an excellent goal, but as interesting as the mockup seems, the execution is what it's all going to boil down to.


Image via Bu…
articles.title: Destiny 2’s new Portal UI could help new players make sense of the game

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
In NBA 2K25, the answers to 2KTV episodes can be a steady source of some great rewards to help your cause in modes like MyTeam and MyCareer. 


The first episode is still available as of writing, which aired back on Wednesday, September 4. There are 13 questions as part of the first set, and read on to get the correct answers for all of them. But that's not all, as a new episode is expected to be released every week. For now, let's check out the correct answers for all the available questions. 


NBA 2K25 2KTV episode one answers


Here's the complete list of all 13 questions you will come across in the first episode, along with all the answers. 


Question
Answer




NBA 2K25 features our _ season?
11th


What position will you choose for your first build?
Any (2KTV Clothing Item)


Chris…
articles.title: All NBA 2K25 2KTV answers

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
While working your way through the Operations in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2, you're going to end up battling the Tyranid horde's Hive Tyrant. This monster controls every Tyranid on the planet and keeps them working together, so it needs to go down. 


The Hive Tyrant is the one who keeps every Tyranid in the swarm, working in unison towards a single goal. In Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2's campaign, this means that the only way to prevent the Tyranids from working to stop all Space Marine objectives is to take the leader out. You'll face it in the later Operations missions, but it's a tough fight you won't be able to win unless you persevere, so I've got some tips to help you do just that. 


How to defeat the Hive Tyrant boss in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2


Screenshot by Destructoid…
articles.title: How to defeat the Hive Tyrant boss in Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I’ve been space trucking since I was a teenager and discovered Elite 2: Frontier and Frontier: First Encounters. Later, it was Freelancer. Somewhere along the line, I lost the love of moving freight through the vacuous unknown. That was, until Star Trucker.


Often, the actual delivery portion of any given space game is optional. There’s usually piracy, combat, maybe mining. There are lots of ways to make a buck in the endless expanse of the universe. Star Trucker, on the other hand, is entirely about trucking through the stars. It’s more than just pressing the pedal down; but all its additional features are in service of your delivery.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Star Trucker (PC [Reviewed], Xbox Series X|S)
Developer: Monster and Monster
Publisher: Raw Fury
Released: September 3, 2024
…
articles.title: Review: Star Trucker

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Verizon is pushing back against a copyright infringement lawsuit filed by several major music labels, arguing that inaction in response to piracy notices doesn't equate to liability. Citing a recent Supreme Court ruling, Verizon is calling for an end to these "lucrative" piracy liability lawsuits. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Verizon Asks Court to Dismiss Music Labels’ Piracy Liability Lawsuit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Motion Picture Association (MPA) has submitted its latest overview of piracy threats to the European Commission. The submission details many of the usual targets, including torrent sites, streaming portals, and piracy apps. The main theme, however, concerns the role of third-party intermediaries. According to the MPA, these companies should take more responsibility, whether they like it or not.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Hollywood and Netflix Report Piracy Threats to the EU, Call for ‘Intermediary’ Action

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Swedish anti-piracy group Rights Alliance has just announced the prosecution of a man allegedly behind pirate IPTV service 'Ghost Farmer TV'. The case is one of several initiated in Sweden in recent years but, for rightsholders, a few prosecutions simply isn't enough. Sweden's Justice Minister considers calls from anti-piracy groups to start going after subscribers premature. That said, the government isn't ruling it out.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV Arrests in Sweden Should Include Users, Rightsholders Tell Govt.

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Borderlands' tops the chart, followed by 'Trap'. 'Inside Out 2' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 09/09/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A study published this week by researchers in Spain shows how the intent to subscribe to a streaming platform is affected when potential subscribers are presented with stimuli such as advertising-based discounts, loyalty-based discounts, and prosocial anti-piracy messages. When direct threats enter the equation, does the fear factor help or hinder the intent to subscribe?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Threatening Anti-Piracy Messaging Fails to Stimulate Intent to Subscribe

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Sports piracy has been on the rise and pay-per-view events, in particular, are widely accessed through illegal channels. Turki Alalshikh, an advisor at the Royal Court in Saudi Arabia, made a suggestion this week to drastically reduce PPV pricing to cut piracy. American boxer Chris Algieri has an even more drastic idea: "Make it free," he says. UFC CEO Dana White, meanwhile, sees more mileage in prosecuting pirates. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Make Pay-Per-View Access to Boxing Events Free to Fight Piracy’

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
KimCartoon, a pirate site dedicated to all things cartoon, surprised users this week with a sudden "That's All Folks" before shutting itself down. With an estimated 120 million visits over the last 12 months alone, KimCartoon was a very busy site and with that kind of traffic, life can get complicated. The site's operator says the site was shut down "due to DMCA" but, after weathering many storms over the years, maybe there's a little bit more to it than that.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: That’s All Folks: KimCartoon’s 120m Visit Piracy Caper Ends in a DMCA Disaster

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Danish police have arrested a 39-year-old man who shared nude scenes of more than a hundred female actors through Reddit and porn sites. The suspect has been charged with copyright infringement. While posting small clips from movies or TV-shows typically doesn't result in criminal action, taking nude clips out of context is considered a breach of actors' and filmmakers' integrity.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Man Arrested for Sharing Copyright Infringing Nude Scenes Through Reddit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals has dealt a blow to the Internet Archive's digital book lending program. The court upheld a lower court's decision, stating that IA's practice of scanning and lending copyrighted books without permission is not fair use. IA's lending program directly threatens the revenues of publishers and violates copyright law, the judges ruled.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Internet Archive Loses Landmark E-Book Lending Copyright Appeal Against Publishers

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Major sports rightsholders and broadcasters in Canada have selected UK-based site-blocking veterans Friend MTS to carry out all pirate IPTV blocking under a Federal Court injunction obtained during the summer. The fact that NHL, NBA, and Premier League streams will be blocked by major Canadian ISPs was widely reported. Yet, with significantly less fanfare, it appears that the UFC and MLB have also entered the blocking arena.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC & MLB Join Pirate IPTV Blocking as Broadcasters Collaborate to Cut Costs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
This weekend, popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy went 'offline' displaying an image that some interpreted as a farewell message. Today the site returned and uploads at third-party sites resumed simultaneously. This is the second time in a few weeks that the site has gone through this mysterious cycle. The main question that remains: Why?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy is Back Online & Uploads Resume

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After obtaining an injunction and an invasive search and seizure order at Canada's Federal Court, teams from Bell, Rogers, Disney, Paramount, Columbia, and Warner Bros. targeted the alleged operators of IPTV service SmoothStreams at their homes in Canada. The defendants were charged with contempt of court when they failed to comply with the terms of the order. Two years later, the defendants are paying a heavy price and the main case hasn't even started.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bell, Rogers & MPA’s Pirate IPTV Lawsuit is a Slow-Motion Money Pit Nightmare

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Nhentai, a popular adult site with dozens of millions of monthly visits, has been sued for copyright infringement. The lawsuit was filed by California company PCR Distributing, which operates several hentai brands. The complaint alleges that nhentai doesn't respond to takedown notices. The site attempted to settle the dispute confidentially months ago, but that attempt failed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Pirate’ Site nHentai Sued in U.S. Court for Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A co-founder of a group, formed to raise awareness of "damaging" religious instruction received by schoolchildren in the U.S., now has support from the Electronic Frontier Foundation. After Zachary Parrish published the LifeWise Academy's children's curriculum on the website of 'Parents Against LifeWise' he was sued for copyright infringement. In support of a motion to dismiss, EFF says that copyright law isn't a tool to silence critics and a fair use defense will prevail.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: EFF Assists Critic’s Fair Use Defense Over Kids’ Religious Program ‘Leak’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cheat seller AimJunkies has suffered two new setbacks in its legal battle with 'Destiny 2' developer Bungie. The Seattle District Court refused to overturn a jury verdict issued in May and will not grant a new trial. Separately, the Court of Appeals affirmed a $4.3 million arbitration award, concluding that no clear errors were made and that the scale of the award is not “completely irrational”
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Court Denies Cheat Seller AimJunkies a New Trial, Affirms Bungie’s $4.3m Win

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The spectacular demise of Fmovies, Aniwave, and a dozen or more related big-brand pirate sites, has former users asking the same question: Are they really gone forever? With many resurrections and Dr. Who-like regenerations over recent years, some seem optimistic. Government records suggests that business bridges are being built from Hollywood to Vietnam, and back again. It seems unlikely that the resurrection of pirate sites would help in any way.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Fmovies & Aniwave: Will The Masters of Pirate Resurrection Rise Again?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy once again confuses users with a mysterious message. Instead of the usual list of downloads, it simply shows an image from the film Logan and the brief message "TG Forever". This is similar to a notice that appeared on the site a few weeks ago, after which it eventually resumed business as usual. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy Spooks Users with More ‘Downtime’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Earlier this month, U.S. law enforcement seized several domain names belonging to popular sports streaming site Streameast. However, instead of shutting down operations, the site is fighting back. After launching new backup domains, the site's operators inform TorrentFreak that they plan to challenge the seizure warrant in court.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sports Streaming Site Streameast Plans to Appeal U.S. Domain Name Seizures

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Despite malware having an even worse reputation than piracy, until now police operations to take sites down, explicitly because they're involved in both, have been pretty much non-existent. This week, music industry group IFPI revealed Operation Redirect, "the first operation of its kind in Brazil to target illegal sites associated with malware distribution." Intrigued by the announcement, we took a closer look and found plenty of drama.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Operation Redirect: Police Anti-Malware Action Protects Music & Pirates

Support for Pixel 9 Series Devices
You can now test your apps on the Google Pixel 9 series device configurations. Android Studio and the latest Android Emulator now have device definitions for the Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL, and the Pixel 9 Pro Fold, enabling you to validate your apps on these virtual devices to ensure they react correctly to a variety of screen sizes and device types. You should use API 35 with the Pixel 9 AVDs to ensure the best experience and access to the latest platform features.
